extraction_notes.notes: Fresh extraction for variability test Run 05 - final run

evidence.verbatim_quote: In this study we used a dataset of 773 mounds, collected by TRAP during 2009–2011 field survey in the Kazanlak Valley, Bulgaria

evidence.content: First model reported F1 score of 0.87
evidence.verbatim_quote: After image augmentation, the model reported good learning and model fit (F1 = 0.87)

evidence.content: First run: only 19/148 tagged tiles (12.8%) contained mounds
evidence.verbatim_quote: Nevertheless, only 19 out of 148 tiles (12.8%) tagged by the model with at least a 60% chance of having a mound actually contained one
The 19 true-positive tiles contained 38 mounds (1–9 mounds per tile), out of 773 in the study area (4.9%)
Some 129 of the tagged tiles (87.1%) were false positives
Undetected mounds were located in 381 tiles (1–20 mounds per tile) out of 400 tiles that actually contained mounds, a false negative rate of 95.3%
The second model's performance declined to an F1 score of 0.62
Validation revealed that only 21 of 773 mounds (2.7%) were detected, while 752 mounds (97.3%) remained undetected
The remaining 273 of 288 tiles were false positives (94.8%)
The undetected 752 mounds lay in 384 tiles (1–28 mounds per tile) out of 399 tiles that actually contained mounds, a false negative rate of 96.2%
Developing our CNN model required approximately 135 person-hours from conceptualisation and experiments to validation and documentation

evidence.content: Model detected edges and lines rather than round shapes
evidence.verbatim_quote: Overall, the model seemed to select bright lines and edges (forest, roads), rather than round shapes more likely to represent mounds

evidence.content: 249 visible mounds used for second run training data
evidence.verbatim_quote: In the 2022 run, we selected 249 cutouts where a mound was discernible with the naked eye

evidence.content: Model missed largest, most visible mounds
evidence.verbatim_quote: The greatest surprise was that the model failed to detect the largest mounds in the valley. These round, symmetrical features stand out against surrounding agricultural fields, and are crystal clear to any human viewer

evidence.content: Three public GitHub repositories contain all code
evidence.verbatim_quote: Code: Data processing and analysis was performed using R and Python and the scripts are available in public repositories

evidence.content: Literature review: 63% of 70 papers fail to mention ML limitations
evidence.verbatim_quote: Considering the 70 papers from the Web of Science mentioned above, 44 abstracts (63%) fail to mention any negative aspects of AI/ML approaches at all

evidence.content: Model flagged reservoir water as likely mound locations
evidence.verbatim_quote: Furthermore, the model flagged parts of the reservoir as a mound with >60% probability, despite the homogeneous water surface

claims.content: Self-reported ML metrics do not predict real-world performance
claims.verbatim_quote: Validation of results against field data showed that self-reported success rates were misleadingly high, and that the model was misidentifying most features

claims.content: Transfer learning fails for heterogeneous archaeological landscapes
claims.verbatim_quote: Our attempt to deploy a pre-trained CNN demonstrates the limitations of this approach when it is used to detect varied features of different sizes within a heterogeneous landscape

claims.content: Curating training data for visible features worsened performance
claims.verbatim_quote: Counterintuitively, the model provided with training data selected for highly visible mounds (rather than all mounds) performed worse

claims.content: External validation with field data is essential for ML archaeological workflows
claims.verbatim_quote: The model has detected incidental features rather than the mounds themselves, making external validation with field data an essential part of CNN workflows

claims.content: Model detected background features rather than targets
claims.verbatim_quote: Models have been observed to predict class membership based on incidental background features in the periphery of the tiles that happen to accompany the target phenomenon in the centre

claims.content: Manual approaches may be more efficient for some applications
claims.verbatim_quote: The degree of manual intervention required... is so significant that it raises the question of whether it would be more efficient to identify all of the mounds manually

claims.content: Publication bias affects ML archaeology literature
claims.verbatim_quote: The overwhelmingly positive tone of these papers likely indicates a certain degree of 'publication bias'

claims.content: Both model runs failed to identify burial mounds
claims.verbatim_quote: Indeed, both models failed to identify burial mounds in our study area
It may be counterintuitive, but care in creating the NOT MOUND tiles is as – if not more – important than the MOUND tiles

claims.content: Low-touch training approach fails for complex detection tasks
claims.verbatim_quote: The high number of both false negatives and false positives demonstrated that our use of a low-touch approach – a pre-trained model plus sufficient but minimally curated training data – did not work

claims.content: Cost and resource information needed for informed ML adoption
claims.verbatim_quote: We reiterate the call... for researchers to publish the challenges, costs, and resourcing requirements alongside results

claims.content: Additional training data curation failed to improve results
claims.verbatim_quote: Overall, despite additional curation of the training data, the second run was even less successful than the first

claims.content: ML approaching mainstream adoption in archaeological remote sensing
claims.verbatim_quote: AI/ML is on the cusp of 'crossing the chasm' separating 'innovators' and 'early adopters'... from the 'early majority'

claims.content: Overlapping tiles and variable window sizes could improve detection
claims.verbatim_quote: During discovery, iterating the CNN over the image using overlapping tiles of different sizes would give each mound a higher likelihood of falling completely inside a tile

implicit_arguments.content: Success in homogeneous environments does not transfer to heterogeneous ones
implicit_arguments.reconstructed_from: Comparison to successful Siberian applications implies landscape complexity is key differentiator

implicit_arguments.content: Internal metrics are insufficient for evaluating ML archaeological applications
implicit_arguments.reconstructed_from: The dramatic gap between F1 scores and field validation implies need for external validation

implicit_arguments.content: Negative results contribute to scientific progress
implicit_arguments.reconstructed_from: Paper explicitly frames itself as cautionary corrective to publication bias

implicit_arguments.content: Transparency about resources enables informed adoption decisions
implicit_arguments.reconstructed_from: Explicit call for cost reporting implies this should be standard practice

implicit_arguments.content: Human expertise remains valuable alongside automated approaches
implicit_arguments.reconstructed_from: Finding that humans easily see what models miss implies continued role for domain expertise

research_designs.description: Two-run experiment comparing training data strategies

variables.independent: Training data selection (all 773 vs 249 visible mounds)

research_designs.description: External validation against independent ground truth
Analysis of ML archaeological remote sensing publications
Documentation of time and expertise requirements

methods.description: Systematic field survey recording mound locations, dimensions, and preservation

methods.description: Pre-trained ResNet-50 with MOUND/NOT MOUND additional training

methods.description: GIS intersection of predictions with ground truth

methods.description: Web of Science systematic search and classification

methods.description: Band fusion and tiling of IKONOS imagery

protocols.description: GPS recording, dimensional measurement, preservation assessment

protocols.name: Literature search
protocols.description: Web of Science query with manual review
